info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 12 at 6:54PM EDT until August 12 at 7:45PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pittsburgh has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Harrison County in east central Ohio... Southern Jefferson County in east central Ohio... West central Washington County in southwestern Pennsylvania... Ohio County in northern West Virginia... Brooke County in northern West Virginia... * Until 745 PM EDT. * At 654 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Cadiz, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. * Locations impacted include... Steubenville, Cadiz, Wellsburg, West Liberty, Avella, Clearview, Wintersville, Mingo Junction, Follansbee, Hooverson Heights, Tiltonsville, Yorkville, Bethany, Hopedale, Smithfield, Claysville, Adena, Franklin, Dillonvale, and Beech Bottom. This includes Interstate 70 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 2 and 6. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for east central Ohio...southwestern Pennsylvania...and northern West Virginia. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
